intro: Jatropha paraguayensis, commonly known as the Paraguay physic nut, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, often thorny stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into follicles containing toxic, orange-red seeds. It is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant contains latex and is known for its medicinal and toxic properties.
